conclusion: The problem involves finding the position of a particle at t = 8s using its velocity-time graph and initial position.
Initial position of the particle is x = 5 m at t = 0 s, and it starts moving in the positive x-axis direction.
The velocity-time graph is provided, and the position at t = 8 s needs to be determined.
From t = 0 to t = 1 s, velocity increases linearly from 0 to 2 m/s.
From t = 1 to t = 3 s, velocity remains constant at 2 m/s.
From t = 3 to t = 4 s, velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s.
From t = 4 to t = 5 s, velocity decreases linearly from 0 to -1 m/s.
From t = 5 to t = 7 s, velocity remains constant at -1 m/s.
From t = 7 to t = 8 s, velocity increases linearly from -1 m/s to 0 m/s.
Displacement from t = 0 to t = 1 s is calculated as (1/2) × 1 s × 2 m/s = 1 m.
Displacement from t = 1 to t = 3 s is calculated as 2 m/s × 2 s = 4 m.
Displacement from t = 3 to t = 4 s is calculated as (1/2) × 1 s × 2 m/s = 1 m.
Displacement from t = 4 to t = 5 s is calculated as (1/2) × 1 s × (-1 m/s) = -0.5 m.
Displacement from t = 5 to t = 7 s is calculated as (-1 m/s) × 2 s = -2 m.
Displacement from t = 7 to t = 8 s is calculated as (1/2) × 1 s × (-1 m/s) = -0.5 m.
Total displacement is calculated as 1 m + 4 m + 1 m + (-0.5 m) + (-2 m) + (-0.5 m) = 3 m.
Final position is calculated as Initial position + Displacement = 5 m + 3 m = 8 m.
The position of the particle on the x-axis at t = 8 s is determined to be 8 meters.
